title: 107_s3009
content: The "Emergency Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002" includes provisions for extending temporary extended unemployment compensation, entitlement to additional weeks of benefits, application of revised insured unemployment rates, trigger for extended benefit periods, additional benefits for workers in high unemployment states, and an effective date. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is extended for six months, amending Section 208 to specify its applicability. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is extended until July 1, 2003, with provisions for transition for individuals receiving benefits. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is extended until July 1, 2003, with provisions for transition for individuals receiving benefits, with the effect as if included in the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. Amends the amount of extended unemployment compensation to be equal to 26 times the individual's weekly benefit amount. SEC. 4. Applies the revised rate of insured unemployment. Section 207 of the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is amended to define general terms and adjust the insured unemployment rate for individuals exhausting their regular compensation. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is amended to include individuals exhausting their regular compensation in the insured unemployment rate calculation. SEC. 5. ADDITIONAL TEUC EXTENDED BENEFIT PERIOD TRIGGER. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is amended to include an additional extended benefit period trigger for weeks of unemployment beginning after the Emergency Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is amended to include a new trigger for extended benefits based on specific unemployment rate criteria in a State. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is amended to include a new trigger for extended benefits based on specific unemployment rate criteria in a State. The criteria involve determining State 'on' or 'off' indicators for certain weeks based on total unemployment rates. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is amended to include a new trigger for extended benefits based on specific unemployment rate criteria in a State. The Secretary will determine total unemployment in any State for any period, with no seasonal adjustment, and a conforming amendment is made to Section 203(c)(1) of the Act. SEC. 6. Amends the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 to provide additional weeks of benefits for workers in high unemployment states. The amendment changes the calculation method for benefits to 7 times the individual's weekly benefit amount. SEC. 7. Specifies that the amendments apply to weeks of unemployment starting after the enactment of the Act.
